segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 Firewall for App-V
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 Firewall for App-V

segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 Firewall for App-V
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 Firewall for App-V

segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 Firewall for App-V
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 Firewall for App-V

segment.source: With the introduction of Windows Server 2008, the firewall and IPsec components were merged into one service, and the capabilities of this service were enhanced.
segment.target: With the introduction of Windows Server 2008, the firewall and IPsec components were merged into one service, and the capabilities of this service were enhanced.

segment.source: The new firewall service supports incoming and outgoing stateful inspection.
segment.target: The new firewall service supports incoming and outgoing stateful inspection.

segment.source: Also, you can configure specific firewall rules and IPsec policies through group policies.
segment.target: Also, you can configure specific firewall rules and IPsec policies through group policies.

segment.source: For additional information about the Windows firewall in Windows Server 2008, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151980.
segment.target: For additional information about the Windows firewall in Windows Server 2008, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151980.

segment.source: The following procedure does not include adding an exception for ICO and OSD publishing through SMB or HTTP/HTTPS.
segment.target: The following procedure does not include adding an exception for ICO and OSD publishing through SMB or HTTP/HTTPS.

segment.source: Those exceptions are automatically added based on the network profile and roles installed on the Windows Server 2008 firewall.
segment.target: Those exceptions are automatically added based on the network profile and roles installed on the Windows Server 2008 firewall.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the Management Server is configured to use RTSP, repeat this procedure to add the program as an exception.
segment.target: If the Management Server is configured to use RTSP, repeat this procedure to add the program as an exception.

segment.source: The App-V Streaming Server requires the program exception for RTSPS communication.
segment.target: The App-V Streaming Server requires the program exception for RTSPS communication.

segment.source: An App-V Streaming Server that uses RTSP for communication also requires a program exception for .
segment.target: An App-V Streaming Server that uses RTSP for communication also requires a program exception for .

segment.source: To configure Windows Server 2008 firewall for App-V
segment.target: To configure Windows Server 2008 firewall for App-V

segment.source: Open the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security management console through the Control Panel or by typing on the Run line.
segment.target: Open the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security management console through the Control Panel or by typing on the Run line.

segment.source: Create a new inbound rule, and select Program.
segment.target: Create a new inbound rule, and select Program.

originalData.data: `%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft System Center App Virt Management Server\App Virt Management Server\bin`

segment.source: Select the program path, and browse to , which is located by default at .
segment.target: Select the program path, and browse to , which is located by default at .

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Action page, select Allow the connection, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Action page, select Allow the connection, and then click Next.

segment.source: Select the appropriate Profiles to apply to the inbound rule.
segment.target: Select the appropriate Profiles to apply to the inbound rule.

segment.source: Provide a name and description for the rule, and click Finish.
segment.target: Provide a name and description for the rule, and click Finish.
